ai.summary: Fir Trail is a moderate-length woodland hike in the United Kingdom. This listing notes the route as 11.2 km, though it is commonly marketed as a 5 km trail. The path includes gentle gradients, uneven footing, and occasional muddy sections, making it suitable for hikers with some experience and good navigation.
ai.terrain_summary: Forest track with roots, grassy clearings, and occasional mud. Mostly well-defined trails, but visibility can be limited in dense sections. Elevation gain is gradual with short ascents; footing can be uneven and slippery when wet.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for UK weather variability. Carry waterproof clothing and extra layers; stay on marked paths; tell someone your route and expected return time. Bring a map and compass or GPS, and ensure your phone is charged. Be cautious of mud, roots, and slippery surfaces, and watch for livestock or wildlife in rural sections.
recommended_gear: Water bottle or hydration system (2 L or more)
Map and compass or GPS device
Fully charged mobile phone and power bank
Lightweight rain shell or packable poncho
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn in the UK; summer offers longer daylight and generally drier days but can include sudden rain; winter hiking is possible with extra caution due to mud and reduced daylight.

seo.title: Fir Trail: 11.2 km Moderate Woodland Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore Fir Trail, a moderate 11.2 km woodland hike in the United Kingdom. Find terrain details, safety tips, and gear recommendations for a day on the trail.
